speaker: Victoria S. Meadows
transcript: characteristic impacts that the complex process that of life might have on an environment. And then also potentially looking at not just finding biosignatures on a single planet, but using ensembles of planets um to perhaps allow us to get at the probability of life um in a given population of planets. Then finally, I think our most important um frontier is really developing all of the bits and pieces that we are going to need for a probabilistic framework for biosignature assessment. screenshare_content: The screen shows a presentation slide titled "Frontiers In Biosignature Science". The slide lists three main points: deep study of O2, the search for novel biosignatures, and the development of a probabilistic framework for biosignature assessment. The slide also contains images related to biosignatures and planetary environments. The slide changes from a slide with a graph and network diagram to a slide with a planet image.
